title: Daelin Hayes, 5-star LB, de-commits from USC Trojans following Steve Sarkisian leave of absence
text:
As news broke Sunday that USC coach Steve Sarkisian was taking a leave of absence from the program, it immediately became clear that there could be a potential recruiting fallout.
"I called Steve and talked to him," Haden told the Los Angeles Times and others . "It was very clear to me that he is not healthy. I asked him to take an indefinite leave of absence."
The news, coupled with Sarkisian's alcohol and medication-induced comments at a USC pep rally , have many recruits questioning the stability and future of the USC football program.
On Sunday evening, Rivals five-star linebacker Daelin Hayes , the second highest-rated pledge in the Pac-12 Conference , announced his de-commitment from the program.
"At this time my family and I feel that it is in my best interest to de-commit from the University of Southern California and open up my recruiting process," Hayes wrote on Twitter. "I'd like to thank the USC Coaching staff for the opportunities that they have placed before me."
pic.twitter.com/HrCdpkiAQk
— ⚡️Daelin Hayes⚡️ (@DaelinHayes_24) October 11, 2015
Hayes had already signed a financial aid agreement, but the non-binding contract allows him to consider other programs until he signs a National Letter of Intent in early February.
The 6-foot-3, 254-pound linebacker, out of Ann Arbor, Michigan, holds offers from many of the top programs in the country, including Alabama, Georgia, LSU, Michigan, Oklahoma, Ohio State and others.
The Oregon Ducks had shown interest earlier in Hayes' recruitment, but had not yet offered the dynamic defensive talent.
Given the latest developments with Sarkisian and USC, expect programs from around the country to enquire about current Trojans commitments.
